<a href="https://athleticgreens.com/partner/morningbrew/us?utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_source=tech-primary0130&rfsn=3517928.8ad866" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Athletic Greens" style="width:100%;max-width: 180px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="180" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2ODcyMDU0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>You know the saying “too good to be true”? It’s very real. Tuesday night, MoviePass and its parent company Helios and Matheson Analytics filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy, meaning the movie ticket subscription service is gone for good. We surveyed our coworkers for their fondest memories…<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Jamie, editorial coordinator: </strong></span><span>“Watching </span><span><em>Call Me By Your Name </em></span><span>three times in a row”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Blake, creative director: </strong></span><span><span>“It not working at the kiosk and asking a theater employee and them looking at me like I have three heads and those three heads are actually butts”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Josh, strategy & operations lead: </strong></span><span><span>“MoviePass died so AMC A-List could fly”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/l-brands-reportedly-weighing-sale-victorias-secret-wexner-talks-step?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
L Brands Treats Its C-Suite Like Pesky Underwire
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Victoria's Secret wings on a coat hanger " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMzM4OTMzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If it’s poking you in the ribs, get rid of it. L Brands CEO Leslie Wexner, the longest-serving CEO of an S&P 500 company, is reportedly in talks to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/victorias-secret-billionaire-in-talks-to-step-aside-and-sell-brand-11580299200?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">step down</a> while the company considers strategic alternatives (including a sale) for its Victoria’s Secret brand. The WSJ first reported the news.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Victoria’s Secret is both Wexner’s brainchild and L Brands’s largest property. But as it <a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/l-brands-chief-reportedly-exploring-sale-of-victorias-secret/571322/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struggles to adapt</a> to changing consumer preferences, it’s weighing down smaller but more fragrant L Brands companies like Bath & Body Works. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A downward spiral </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The generation that grew up on 5 for $25 has abandoned “how to add two cup sizes” in favor of “how to feel comfortable,” an ethos <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/victorias-secret-founder-les-wexner-is-reportedly-in-talks-to-step-aside-and-is-exploring-l-brands-sale.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seized upon</a> by anti-VS brands like ThirdLove and Aerie.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a long way to fall for Victoria’s Secret, once the end-all-be-all of the U.S. lingerie market. The chain does about $7 billion in annual sales...but that’s where the good stats end.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Same-store holiday sales at VS declined 12% last year. And with heavy promotions to make up for slower traffic, margins also took a hit.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Sales have </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-l-brands-ceo/l-brands-ceo-in-talks-to-step-aside-and-sell-victorias-secret-wsj-idUSKBN1ZS1J5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slid</a></span><span> for at least four quarters.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Its marketing department is in a tailspin. VS axed its annual fashion show last year following blowback for promoting unhealthy body image and sidestepping diversity + inclusion.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>“discussions are ongoing,” as the kids say, and reportedly could result in a partial or full sale of VS. L Brands will decide on the sale as well as Wexner succession plans <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/29/investing/leslie-wexner-victorias-secret/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in the coming weeks,</a> WSJ sources say. And speaking of Wexner, he was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/les-wexner-victorias-secret.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closely associated</a> with disgraced late financier and accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Possible proof investors want to see Wexner go: L Brands shares jumped 13% Wednesday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><strong style="color:#000">+ Want more retail news?</strong> Check out our newsletter <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=retailbrew&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Retail Brew</a>.</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/microsoft-tesla-facebook-reported-earnings-bell?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Earnings Reports Make Us Reconsider the Rule of Three
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's only one justifiable reason to have missed your spin class last night, and that's because you were poring over the financials of the three corporate giants reporting earnings after the bell. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tesla nailed it.</strong> The electric automaker <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/tesla-tsla-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beat Q4 expectations</a> across the board, sending shares more than 11% higher in after-hours trading. Elon Musk is on a magic carpet ride:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tesla already reported a record 112,000 vehicle deliveries in Q4. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Going into yesterday’s update, shares had increased over 120% from Tesla’s Q3 earnings report (which handed investors a surprise profit).</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Microsoft also nailed it, </strong><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/microsoft-msft-earnings-q2-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topping</a> expectations on the top and bottom lines for its fiscal second quarter. If Microsoft has given us anything, it’s <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">a Minesweeper addiction</span> continuity—for yet another quarter, its Azure cloud business was the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-earnings-set-for-another-cloud-record-11580295602?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shining star</a> that helped grow revenue 14%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Facebook...did something else. </strong>It <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/facebook-fb-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> more users and Q4 revenue up 25% annually to $21.1 billion. So why did shares fall ~7% in extended trading? Well, there are <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/briefings/536e41?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">higher expenses</a> to worry about. And “<span>strong performance has become almost a given for the company</span>,” <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-reports-25-revenue-growth-in-latest-quarter-11580333926?mod=breakingnews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as the WSJ writes</a>. FB has to go above and beyond to score points with investors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thinking face emoji: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/P-4G1qg70PQS2NsLVQtinwAkb5F1j7_gI7yJ7AMks4toJlE86Bh3TWh2Ax0Nlc2B0KXBz-OfAYjPPlsjv9Fm8j9xznS3JbMFfOILeJ2XLnm77qqdaCDGgJz3j-GVzroSMtRC5UUQ" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><a href="https://twitter.com/pkafka/status/1222634566281846790?s=12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>@pkafka</em></a></sup></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/penn-national-gaming-buys-stake-values-barstool-sports-450-million?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pardon My Stake
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Big Cat and PFT Commenter from Barstool Sports " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKDd0LHXb2GHHW0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Big Cat and PFT Commenter from Barstool Sports " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3o7TKDd0LHXb2GHHW0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Casino operator Penn National Gaming has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/penn-national-gaming-to-buy-minority-stake-in-barstool-sports-11580274060?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed</a> to buy a stake in Barstool Sports that values the blog/gambling/podcast/merch machine at $450 million.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Penn National paid $163 million for a 36% stake. In three years, it’ll pay another $62 million to bring its stake to 50%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Penn National:</strong> It’s hoping Barstool’s <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/1/29/21113130/barstool-sports-penn-national-deal-dave-portnoy-chernin?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cult-like audience</a> of roughly 66 million <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-29/barstool-sports-agrees-to-sell-36-stake-to-penn-national-gaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will become</a> regular patrons of its casinos and forthcoming sports betting app. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In </span><span><a href="https://www.barstoolsports.com/video/1747076/emergency-press-conference-barstool-sports-is-now-accepting-passengers-to-the-moon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">his video</a></span><span> announcing the deal, Barstool President Dave Portnoy encouraged his followers to buy Penn National stock. And despite the 3 minutes and 18 seconds of legal disclaimers that followed, shares spiked 11%.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Barstool: </strong>Penn National has the infrastructure Barstool needs. Plus, if you’ve ever been to the Tropicana in Las Vegas (Penn’s best-known property), you understand why Barstool feels it’s found a partner that understands its brand.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Since the U.S. Supreme Court cleared the way for legal sports betting in 2018, Americans have placed more than $17 billion in sports wagers generating $1.2 billion in revenue for sportsbooks. Barstool and Penn National <a href="https://www.axios.com/penn-national-barstool-sports-purchase-ea9de464-ff18-4674-bfe8-209bf93bd44f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">want in</a>.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/goldman-raises-financial-targets-firstever-investor-day?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Our 151-Year-Old Trading House Is Growing Up so Fast
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Goldman Sachs building in Jersey City " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMzI5MDg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Goldman Sachs <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldman-sachs-investor-day/goldman-sachs-sets-growth-targets-but-urges-investor-patience-idUSKBN1ZS0ID?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">held</a> its first-ever investor day. It's a regular event for the bank’s Wall St. rivals, but Goldman has always been as frustratingly impenetrable as the packaging on a new set of scissors. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>No longer. Goldman </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/goldman-sachs-discloses-higher-financial-targets-at-investor-day.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expects</a></span><span> to hit 13% return on equity (ROE) over the next three years and remain in the “mid-teens or higher” beyond that point. Last year’s ROE was 10%. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Face time with investors <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-talks-to-its-critics-in-effort-to-make-friends-11580309376?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is one part</a> of CEO David Solomon’s revamp plan. He took over from Lloyd Blankfein in October 2018 and has prioritized a) transparency and b) a pivot to Main St.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some investors have griped that Goldman leaned on trading for too long while ignoring the rise of passive strategies (“set it and forget it” investing). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Trading revenue </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/203e5f46-3d0a-11ea-b232-000f4477fbca?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a></span><span> 50% across the industry in the decade after 2009. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why under Solomon’s leadership, Goldman tacked on a less-snooty wealth management division, launched a credit card with Apple, and put all its chips on Marcus, Goldman's consumer bank.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Keep in mind: </strong>Trading still accounts for about 40% of Goldman’s revenue.</p>

<img alt="US President Donald Trump signs the United States - Mexico -Canada Trade Agreement during a ceremony on the South Lawn of the White House" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMzIwOTE2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the White House yesterday, President Trump <a href="https://apnews.com/e6ede49e1c07c7e928238c778fd792b5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed into law</a> a revamped North American trade deal known as the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement, or USMCA. The deal a) replaces NAFTA, the 1994 trade deal between the three countries, and b) soothes the concerns of businesses who felt they were playing economic football without a referee. <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/economy/usmca-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here's what's in the deal</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/news-corp-launches-news-aggregator-knewz?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stress Levels Getting Too Low?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s an image to jack them back up where they belong: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/J_foRhel4FWbim5mGtIWRZ83a2A1ohBAtDxuwnvBE4SK1vCoSWQyUmSbbNoKxuxSwoj7E8hu0AA38m5RVBoat3y6hoV26M34TDq9uR7lSaKxy-Whw40w52zXtjUNl1wyYohsk3kH" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt=""><br><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;"><em>Knewz.com homepage</em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, News Corp <a href="https://variety.com/2020/digital/news/news-corp-launches-knewz-with-400-plus-publishers-promising-no-clickbait-or-narrow-minded-nonsense-1203485249/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> Knewz, a news aggregation service. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>News Corp is the Rupert Murdoch-helmed media conglomerate that owns the Wall Street Journal, the New York Post, and the Times of London. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The play: </strong>News Corp is making a homegrown effort to unseat tech companies like Google and Apple as aggregation platforms. Murdoch <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/knewz-news-corps-news-aggregator-goes-live-11580316717?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has complained</a> that publishers should be paid licensing fees when their content is displayed on services like Google News and Apple News+. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The boss: </strong>If anyone knows how to capture attention, it’s a former editor-in-chief of the Daily Mail. News Corp is bringing on one of those, Noah Kotch, to run Knewz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ In other non-Knewz news news: </strong>Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-29/warren-buffett-throws-in-the-towel-on-his-newspaper-empire?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made a rare sale</a>—unloading its news unit, including 30 daily newspapers, to Lee Enterprises for $140 million.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mcdonald-s-corp-results/mcdonalds-sees-2020-spending-on-tech-after-sales-beat-breakfast-competition-looms-idUSKBN1ZS1GD?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">McDonald’s</a></span><span>, feeling good after beating quarterly sales forecasts, said it’s going to invest more in tech and R&D in 2020. The battle for breakfast is raging.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/boeing-ba-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Boeing</a></span><span> posted its first annual loss in over two decades. Costs from the 737 Max crisis have topped $18 billion. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/ges-stock-soars-after-earnings-as-ceo-culp-says-turnaround-is-gaining-traction-2020-01-29?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GE stock</a></span><span> jumped over 10% to a 15-month high after the company reported lots of progress on free cash flow last quarter.</span>
</li>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAPPAREL \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/29/l-brands-reportedly-weighing-sale-victorias-secret-wexner-talks-step?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nL Brands Treats Its C-Suite Like Pesky Underwire\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Victoria's Secret wings on a coat hanger \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgwMzM4OTMzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf it’s poking you in the ribs, get rid of it. L Brands CEO Leslie Wexner, the longest-serving CEO of an S\u0026P 500 company, is reportedly in talks to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/victorias-secret-billionaire-in-talks-to-step-aside-and-sell-brand-11580299200?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estep down\u003c/a\u003e while the company considers strategic alternatives (including a sale) for its Victoria’s Secret brand. The WSJ first reported the news.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eVictoria’s Secret is both Wexner’s brainchild and L Brands’s largest property. But as it \u003ca href=\"https://www.retaildive.com/news/l-brands-chief-reportedly-exploring-sale-of-victorias-secret/571322/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estruggles to adapt\u003c/a\u003e to changing consumer preferences, it’s weighing down smaller but more fragrant L Brands companies like Bath \u0026 Body Works. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA downward spiral \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe generation that grew up on 5 for $25 has abandoned “how to add two cup sizes” in favor of “how to feel comfortable,” an ethos \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/victorias-secret-founder-les-wexner-is-reportedly-in-talks-to-step-aside-and-is-exploring-l-brands-sale.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseized upon\u003c/a\u003e by anti-VS brands like ThirdLove and Aerie.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s a long way to fall for Victoria’s Secret, once the end-all-be-all of the U.S. lingerie market. The chain does about $7 billion in annual sales...but that’s where the good stats end.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSame-store holiday sales at VS declined 12% last year. And with heavy promotions to make up for slower traffic, margins also took a hit.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSales have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-l-brands-ceo/l-brands-ceo-in-talks-to-step-aside-and-sell-victorias-secret-wsj-idUSKBN1ZS1J5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for at least four quarters.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIts marketing department is in a tailspin. VS axed its annual fashion show last year following blowback for promoting unhealthy body image and sidestepping diversity + inclusion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003e“discussions are ongoing,” as the kids say, and reportedly could result in a partial or full sale of VS. L Brands will decide on the sale as well as Wexner succession plans \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/29/investing/leslie-wexner-victorias-secret/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein the coming weeks,\u003c/a\u003e WSJ sources say. And speaking of Wexner, he was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/29/business/les-wexner-victorias-secret.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosely associated\u003c/a\u003e with disgraced late financier and accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePossible proof investors want to see Wexner go: L Brands shares jumped 13% Wednesday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Want more retail news?\u003c/strong\u003e style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere's only one justifiable reason to have missed your spin class last night, and that's because you were poring over the financials of the three corporate giants reporting earnings after the bell. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTesla nailed it.\u003c/strong\u003e The electric automaker \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/tesla-tsla-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeat Q4 expectations\u003c/a\u003e across the board, sending shares more than 11% higher in after-hours trading. Elon Musk is on a magic carpet ride:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTesla already reported a record 112,000 vehicle deliveries in Q4. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoing into yesterday’s update, shares had increased over 120% from Tesla’s Q3 earnings report (which handed investors a surprise profit).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMicrosoft also nailed it, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/microsoft-msft-earnings-q2-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopping\u003c/a\u003e expectations on the top and bottom lines for its fiscal second quarter. If Microsoft has given us anything, it’s \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003ea Minesweeper addiction\u003c/span\u003e continuity—for yet another quarter, its Azure cloud business was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/microsoft-earnings-set-for-another-cloud-record-11580295602?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshining star\u003c/a\u003e that helped grow revenue 14%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook...did something else. \u003c/strong\u003eIt \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/facebook-fb-earnings-q4-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e more users and Q4 revenue up 25% annually to $21.1 billion. So why did shares fall ~7% in extended trading? Well, there are \u003ca href=\"https://www.theinformation.com/briefings/536e41?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehigher expenses\u003c/a\u003e to worry about. And “\u003cspan\u003estrong performance has become almost a given for the company\u003c/span\u003e,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-reports-25-revenue-growth-in-latest-quarter-11580333926?mod=breakingnews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas the WSJ writes\u003c/a\u003e. million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePenn National paid $163 million for a 36% stake. In three years, it’ll pay another $62 million to bring its stake to 50%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Penn National:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s hoping Barstool’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/1/29/21113130/barstool-sports-penn-national-deal-dave-portnoy-chernin?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecult-like audience\u003c/a\u003e of roughly 66 million \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-29/barstool-sports-agrees-to-sell-36-stake-to-penn-national-gaming?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill become\u003c/a\u003e regular patrons of its casinos and forthcoming sports betting app. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.barstoolsports.com/video/1747076/emergency-press-conference-barstool-sports-is-now-accepting-passengers-to-the-moon?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehis video\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e announcing the deal, Barstool President Dave Portnoy encouraged his followers to buy Penn National stock. And despite the 3 minutes and 18 seconds of legal disclaimers that followed, shares spiked 11%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Barstool: \u003c/strong\u003ePenn National has the infrastructure Barstool needs. Plus, if you’ve ever been to the Tropicana in Las Vegas (Penn’s best-known property), you understand why Barstool feels it’s found a partner that understands its brand.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Since the U.S. Supreme Court cleared the way for legal sports betting in 2018, Americans have placed more than $17 billion in sports wagers generating $1.2 billion in revenue for sportsbooks. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Goldman Sachs \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-goldman-sachs-investor-day/goldman-sachs-sets-growth-targets-but-urges-investor-patience-idUSKBN1ZS0ID?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheld\u003c/a\u003e its first-ever investor day. It's a regular event for the bank’s Wall St. rivals, but Goldman has always been as frustratingly impenetrable as the packaging on a new set of scissors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNo longer. Goldman \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/29/goldman-sachs-discloses-higher-financial-targets-at-investor-day.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpects\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to hit 13% return on equity (ROE) over the next three years and remain in the “mid-teens or higher” beyond that point. Last year’s ROE was 10%. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Face time with investors \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-talks-to-its-critics-in-effort-to-make-friends-11580309376?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis one part\u003c/a\u003e of CEO David Solomon’s revamp plan. He took over from Lloyd Blankfein in October 2018 and has prioritized a) transparency and b) a pivot to Main St.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome investors have griped that Goldman leaned on trading for too long while ignoring the rise of passive strategies (“set it and forget it” investing). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTrading revenue \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/203e5f46-3d0a-11ea-b232-000f4477fbca?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 50% across the industry in the decade after 2009. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s why under Solomon’s leadership, Goldman tacked on a less-snooty wealth management division, launched a credit card with Apple, and put all its chips on Marcus, Goldman's consumer bank.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKeep in mind: \u003c/strong\u003eTrading still accounts for about 40% of Goldman’s
